TextBlock.Text: Enji: Well... Isn't this something I wish I had known earlier!
I was just mining this pillar for resources to build the train when I discovered that there was an aquifer right above me.
...And, of course, shortly thereafter the entire upper portion of the pillar broke! I was unharmed, but a little shaken being pushed around by the ensuing flood.
After coming to my senses, I realized I was standing in patch of <color=lightblue>Ghost Matter</color>! ...But I wasn't writhing in burning agony?
Not too long after being bewildered by this, it very much started to burn, as most come to expect. But why did it take so long to start hurting me?

It seems I have accidentally discovered a means to achieve temporary immunity to the effects of <color=lightblue>Ghost Matter</color>. By being completely drenched with water, I can freely touch it without worry.
Frankly, I'm still going to be anxious standing in a cloud of <color=lightblue>Ghost Matter</color> considering all that's between me and certain death is soggy garments.
Further testing shows that I have about <color=orange>one minute</color> after climbing out of water to use my newfound invincibility before I dry off.
<color=orange>Update</color>: I have reminded myself the hard way that <color=orange>water vaporizes quickly</color> in the vacuum of space. Ouch.
